inn1.comm: full outside off, Cook lunges forward and gets a think outside down to third man...not convincing but was in reasonable control
down the leg side, Moeen stays inside the line...opens the extras tally
back of a length on middle, defended back from where it came
hint of seam movement, on a full length around middle and leg, Moeen defends square into the off side
big appeal for caught behind. A loose drive from Moeen, playing away from his body to a delivery angled across outside off. They decide not to review.
aggression from Moeen, he tries to take a length delivery from around off stump over the leg side but there's little timing as he that twists in his hand and the ball lobs over mid-on
full on off stump, defended into the covers
round the wicket, this skids on into Moeen who drives a little riskily off the back foot to point
close! He's a fraction early on his drive, perhaps it stopped in the surface, but the ball flies wide of Dilshan to his right and down to long off
turn there for Dilshan, from a middle and leg line, which squares up Cook in defence
stretches forward this time, bat in front of pad, defended into the leg side
dragged short and a little wide, Cook latches on with a cut which bisects the two fielders in the point area...the outfield is again sluggish
big early strike! The in-form opener departs. Coming down the pitch, aiming over the leg side, loses his shape on the shot. The ball hits his back pad then cannons into leg stump
full outside off, prods into the covers
shorter in length, on off stump, defended square towards point
that's a confidence-booster for Cook, he picks off a short ball with a strong pull shot through midwicket
gets back on a full length outside off, left alone
comes forward, traps the ball off the inside edge into his pad and it trickles back towards the keeper
nicely timed, tucks this delivery off middle stump through midwicket
nearly a return catch as Bell punches off the back foot, again the ball not coming into the bat and it spoons just to the right of Dilshan as he drives across
round the wicket, angled into the pads, rebounds away towards short fine leg
full, dug out back to the bowler
aims to work this from outside off into the leg side, Dilshan gets across in his follow through
tucked to square leg
flicked wide of the deep leg slip, angled into the pads, there wasn't a hand on it but will encourage Mathews to keep the fielder in place
a powerful cover drive but he picks out cover
pushed across outside off, left alone
defeated by a slower ball, 104kph, it was outside off and Cook went for a drive but played over the top of the delivery
finds the gap on this occasion with a cover drive, and with the power and timing to overcome the slow outfield, pierces the gap between cover and mid-off
even fuller this time, the drive comes off the bottom of the bat and runs to mid-off
comes forward, drives the ball into the pitch and it bounces out to short cover
down the pitch and gives himself some room to the leg side, then drives this through square cover...he adjusted well because Dilshan saw him coming and dragged the delivery shorter
round the wicket, on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off
turn into Bell, but started a fraction too straight which allows him to tuck comfortably through midwicket
lovely delivery, turn and bounce, beats the outside edge and Sangakkara whips the bails off. Cook's foot lifted for a second, but was back down in time
well forward and defends to cover
nearly finds long-off, he came down the pitch and was through his shot early but it fell short of the fielder as he ran in. Lack of timing saving Cook
round the wicket, slides on with the air across Cook and takes a thick outside edge to backward point
whipped off the back foot out to deep midwicket
round the wicket, appeal for lbw as the skids on and beats Bell on the back foot but that was easily going down the leg side...think Herath realised half-way through his appeal
forward and defends back to the bowler
good shot, comes down the pitch and lofts this inside out over the off side, wide of long-off but the fielder is able to get around the boundary
now he goes for a sweep, a forceful rather than deft version, goes through square leg for another brace
works this off the back foot into midwicket, significant turn for Dilshan
well bowled! The slider which skids into Cook, cramps him for room as he tries to late cut and that could easily have been dragged into the stumps
defended off the back foot into midwicket
a touch slower, Cook leans forward and defends to the off side...Dilshan throwing himself around in the field
shorter and cut to cover
finds the gap this time, waits a fraction longer and late cuts a wide delivery fine of backward point

picks out long-off! Coming down the pitch, trying to repeat his shot of the previous over, lofts it very straight but without the distance. Thisara Perera judges the catch well, had plenty of time to see it. Nicely bowled by Herath who held the delivery back, Bell wasn't quite to the pitch
takes the edge! But short of slip. Pushed across from round the wicket, Cook leaning forward but his hands were soft enough
worked to midwicket
on leg stump, worked off the pads to midwicket
straighter delivery, Cook gets his front pad on the line of off stump and plays with a closed face
outside leg stump, rolls his wrists on a sweep which finds deep square-leg
short and cut to point
oh dear! England falling apart to spin, again. The captain's problems continue. Swept a full delivery, it takes the top edge and couldn't have picked out deep square-leg with any more precision
defends with the spin to midwicket
a little shorter, he goes onto the back foot and flicks to deep square
round the wicket, outside off, left alone
full and jabbed back to the bowler

oh boy, nearly a shambolic piece of cricket. Root played a late cut to short third man, they were 100% sure over the run and then nearly collided with each other mid-pitch. All okay in the end, but England all over the shop
defended to midwicket
slides on outside off, defended to cover
he counter-attacks with a reverse sweep, the delivery was full outside off, he made sure he kept the ball along the ground
gets across outside off and flicks this with plenty of bottom hand to the on side, but Herath flings himself to his left in his follow through
shorter and worked off the pads into square leg
a little short outside off, driven to the cover sweeper
staying on the back foot, works to midwicket
finds the gap this time, working it off the pads through midwicket
ooh, close leave! Nicely bowled. It was the arm ball and wasn't a million miles from off stump
full and driven down to long-off
gets across onto off stump, defended into the covers
over the wicket, full around middle, tucked into the leg side
leans nicely into a square drive, placed through point
gently driven to cover
coming forward, played back to the bowler
opens the face this time, finds space through the off side to the sweeper
on leg stump, closes the face and places it into the vacant square-leg area
uncertainty from Morgan as he comes forward, playing well in front of his pad, gets an inside edge to the leg side
grips and spins down the leg side, takes an inside fine past the keeper and comes to a halt in the thinkish grass close to the fine-leg bpundary
beaten on the outside edge by another which spins significantly
this one is fuller, head over the ball, defended
dragged shorter and wide, cut firmly through point but deep cover scampers around
driven cautiously to short cover
uses his feet, comes down the pitch and outside off stump, flicks to midwicket
drifts onto leg stump, worked into space on the leg side
pulled down shorter but Morgan's cut picks out backward point
short again, outside off, Morgan late-cuts and gets it fine of backward point
better line, fuller at middle, defended into the covers
quicker delivery, Morgan jabs at it in defence and Mendis fields himself
length ball tucked around the corner to backward square
fuller, blocked back up the wicket
waited for and punched through the covers off the back foot, a careful couple
trying to turn this to leg, the ball is very slow and Root has to check his shot and play up the wicket
slightly pushed through, Root going back and nearly getting into a tangle, gets it up the wicket
across the stumps and flicked out to deep backward square for just a single
touch overpitched but driven only out to the cover sweeper
reverse-swept off the stumps to backward point
leg stump line, turned on the front foot to midwicket
down the wicket, not quite to the pitch but nudges up towards mid-off and they get a sharp single
looked like a variation from the bowler but it was too full and driven hard but only to extra cover who makes a nice driving save to his right
steers this past extra cover and gets a single out to the sweeper
some turn as Root looks to play to leg, gets struck on the pad, appeal for lbw is mainly from the bowler, outside the line surely
back this time and nudging towards point
down the track, right to the pitch and flicking out to deep midwicket for an easy single
back and chopping out to deep cover from just outside off stump

right across his stumps trying to paddle over the leg side, a huge appeal for lbw, did Root hit this? Not out and a leg bye given and Sri Lanka review. It looks very close, Root got a long way across and if he hasn't hit this, he need it be sliding down, I don't think it's high. It's not but it's umpire's call on the leg stump but Hawk Eye has it taking a big chunk of the leg stump but marginally not more than 50% of the ball
back in the crease knocking this up the wicket
well wide of off stump, Root slashes and misses
forward pressing back to the bowler
back this time and forcing hard out to deep cover
trying to get down, pushing to the bowler's left hand and he gets down very nicely to make the save
back in the crease dabbing into the covers and they set off for a sharp single, good running
back and nudging back to the bowler
back and glancing this very late to short third man who gets down well to his right to save at least a couple
good length on off stump, nudged up to mid-off
waited for and chopped down to third man

length ball sliding across Morgan who feels hard for it and pops a catch to short extra cover who gets down well to his right hand side. The slow nature of this pitch evident here, the ball not coming on at all for Morgan leaning outside off to press into the covers, he's there too soon and taps a relatively straightforward chance to the fielder who took a smart catch
forward defence just outside off into the covers
fuller and driven up to mid-off
decent length close to the off stump, Bopara just blocks it coming half-forward
the long-sleeved Root is back and tapping this out to deep cover
tossed up on the leg stump, a gentle sweep to deep square gets Bopara away
middle and leg line, Root gets a fine tickle on it and with the deep fielder having a long chase to his right they can tear back for a third, no easy task in this heat
swept again by Bopara, this is premeditated from outside off, another single behind square on the leg side
full on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
more air here, Root careful in coming out to press to point
full length at the off stump, gently played into the covers
Bopara tries to wait for this and angle square but can only guide towards point
good stride forward flicking into the leg side, slightly in the air but down and away from mid-on's dive, chase round for deep midwicket and they get three
length with a bit of width but Root trying to crack it square gets an under edge into the ground
fuller length, Root forward angling this down to third man
overpitched and driven very nicely through the covers, the timing is superb and it races away from deep cover, first boundary for 11 overs
full length on off stump, driven only to mid-off
back and flicking this past midwicket for a couple, nicely placed
slog swept over the leg side, not the cleanest strike and it plugs at where wide long-on would be and holds up before the rope
trying to turn this to leg, the ball grips a little and takes a leading edge towards point
fuller, driven to short midwicket
swept off the stumps only as far as backward square leg
poor delivery, angling down leg just backward of a length and Root flicks it fine of long leg
now outside off, Root fails with another attempted square slash like the previous over
waited for on the back foot and guided down to third man
defended in the crease, manages to drop this into square leg for a single and the hundred comes up
Root finally connects with a cut but Dilshan plucks it out of the air with a right hand, superb save at backward point
full at the off stump, Root drives up towards mid-on and sets off for a quick single which they make easily
Root right back and getting into a tangle trying to force into the off side, gets an edge to leg
touch shorter, back again and heaved leg side, doesn't time this and just a couple as deep square runs to his left
full, pressed back to the bowler ... no ball! For kicking the stumps over with his trailing leg
off stump line, pressed into the covers and finds the gap
forced off the back foot, thick outside edge past short third man for a couple
back again and cuts this slightly short and wide ball only as far as deep cover
tossed up, swept at, missed down the leg side, no wide given, there was a hint of an appeal, was that in genuine though of some bat? The umpire reckoned there was something on this anyway
good length at the off stump, Bopara forward getting an inside edge which drops towards square leg and and Root calls him through for a sharp single
nudged off the back foot towards backward point where Dilshan swoops to save more runs
Root back and flicking to the right of midwicket, sharp single attempted, Bopara was a little slow to set off but the fielder fumbled so there was no danger
short and pulled down to deep backward square
full length on the stumps, Root flicks out to deep midwicket, just a single again
full on the stumps again, flicked to deep midwicket again
floated up on leg stump, paddle swept out to deep backward square
back and touching a middle and leg delivery to deep midwicket
better line, this is just dropped into cover from a full length
managed to open the face and steer this out to deep cover
full length on off stump, driven firmly down to long-on
more air, carefully defended in front of middle stumps in the crease

full length at the stumps, Root seems to play all around it, huge appeal for lbw and instantly given out. It seemed to be just a straight delivery angled into the stumps, Root was aiming too leg side and when he missed, he was in big trouble, Steve Davis greedily getting his finger up almost before Mathews had the chance to turn around
bumper, easily ducked under
full length on the off stump, defended up the wicket
more of a good length, Buttler defending forward and almost running this back onto his own stumps, manages to kick this away
another calm defensive shot in front of off stump
poor line drifting down leg but Buttler can only tickle it to long leg
short and Bopara is hurried into pulling, getting this off the glove down to long leg
swept off middle and leg out to deep backward square
waited for and nudged off the back foot to backward point who scrambles to his right and makes a smart save
pressed firmly over the top and almost carries this to long-off rushing in
sharp single attempted to mid-on and they get home easily, the fielder a little sluggish
back and pressing towards mid-on, they take the fielder on again and for a second time get in easily
waited for and pushed back only as far as the bowler
forward to a ball on off stump, dropped into the covers, nothing available
fuller ball, pushed wide enough of mid-off for a quick single
change-up towards off stump, Bopara can only fiddle it back to the bowler
another one, a cutter this, blocked out to Dilshan at backward point, patrolling like a hawk in there
full sliding down the leg side, clips the pad and Sangakkara gets across to save any extras
good length just outside off, this is nudged to deep cover for an easy run
nicely looped up on off stump, draws Bopara forward and he drives to point
exposes all his stumps and defends to cover
fuller again, opens the face as he drives but again finds point
paddle-sweeps a straight delivery through short fine-leg and he scampers a second
a similar sweep to the previous ball, taken from off stump behind square on the leg side
pushes square to backward point who is quite deep and Bopara spots the chance for a single
full outside off, driven firmly through the covers and place wide of the sweeper
full on off stump, bat and pad together as he defends
lovely delivery, draws him forward outside off and moves off the seam to beat the outside edge
well, Buttler won't be targetting Prasad. He's fallen to him for the second time in two innings. And in very similar manner, getting an inside edge on a length delivery which cannons into the stumps
full outside off, left alone, good carry through the keeper...after waiting a long time to bowl, he's been right on the money
another one through the keeper, excellent over
he likes the paddle-sweep today - England's players always like the sweep - and helps it to deep square
forward on off stump, defended
driven down the ground to long off
shorter outside off, doesn't really come into the bat as Bopara cuts to the cover sweeper
spins away quite wide of Woakes, he drives off the back foot and finds the energetic Dilshan at cover
again he picks out cover from a delivery that should have gone for runs
comes onto the front foot and drives this to deep cover

dropped by Sangakkara, although not sure Woakes edged it...he drove over a full delivery, Sanga couldn't gather it and no signal from umpire Davis. Would have been an interesting review, looks like bat hit ground
lovely stuff, nips away off the seam and zips past the outside edge
fuller, he walks into the shot and punches to cover
can't pierce the off-side field as he drives a full delivery off the bottom of the bat to mid-off
finds mid-off again, initially the single was cut-off but the shy at the stumps ricochets away for an overthrow...or 'buzzers'
round the wicket, floated up full, driven down the ground
angled into the pads, glances off square of the wicket...Sangakkara sprints after it
full and straight, swept firmly to deep square
this one grips and turns past the outside edge as Woakes presses forward
comes down the pitch, bunts down to long off
opens the face to place this out to deep cover
good work by Prasad in his follow through as he intercepts the punch-drive...Bopara had already set off for a run, but managed to abort
he throws his arms at a wide delivery, aiming for a drive on the up, but doesn't make any contact...more shape away from Prasad
drives on the up again, reasonable connection this time but finds cover
can't thread the needle, drives off the front foot but finds one of the cover ring
ooh, this one slips out as a big full toss which Bopara manages to deflect down to third man...perhaps an attempted slower ball. Called a no-ball for height
full outside off, a controlled edge down to third man and the boundary drought is broken courtesy of a misfield which parries the ball over the rope. Rare error from Sri Lanka in the field
play and miss outside off, ball doesn't reach Sangakkara on the full
full and straight, sweeps to short fine-leg
defended back to the bowler
stays leg-side of the ball, opens the face and dabs into the covers
a good stride forward and a gentle push down the ground
greater aggression this time, down the pitch and drills it along the ground to mid-on
worked off the stumps into midwicket
full on middle, takes an inside edge into square leg
strong shot, drives sweetly straight down the ground - just past the on side of the stumps - and there's more good fielding as Jeevan Mendis dives around the boundary
well placed into the leg side, good weighting off the clip so it bisects deep midwicket and long on
pats this back down the pitch
moves across his stumps then nudges off his pads to square leg

a bonus boundary as Woakes drives at a wider delivery and gets a bottom edge through the legs of Sangakkara. Jayawardene chases hard from slip but can't quite flick it back, he signals that it hit the rope
drives on the up, and in the air, but it falls short of mid-off
down the pitch again, makes it a very full delivery and clubs towards deepish mid-on
defended to short cover
drives out to deep cover
skipping out of his crease and but this takes the bottom of the bat towards long off
down the pitch on the line of leg stump to try and open the off side but finds short cover
short of a length and heaved through the leg side with a pull-whip shot, wide of deep midwicket

dropped, and was Mathews put off by Thisara Perera? Bopara top-edged a short delivery, basically a long hop, as he went for the pull...Mathews tracked back from short fine-leg and Perera was running in, probably got into the corner of the captain's eye. He pull off a full-length dive and it didn't stick
driven strong through the off side
dabbed off the pads to short fine-leg

just as the stand was building, and Bopara needed support, Woakes charges down the pitch and is beaten leaving Sangakkara which a simple stumping. Hang on, the umpire wants to check the no-ball. It's very tight, is anything grounded behind the line? This would be very careless from Mendis. The foot drags forward a touch, and it's ruled to legal. Just.
short of a length, worked off his pads to get off the mark first ball and keep the strike
full outside off, driven down to long on
nudges a full delivery towards long on to reach a very sensible fifty...without him England would be nowhere
worked to midwicket
goes back to quite a full delivery, it squeezes off a thick outside edge towards short third man

well, what's happened here?! This could be a very strange run out as the throw from mid-on rebounds off Tredwell into the stumps but he's very safe. Or is the appeal about an obstruction. Tredwell didn't know anything about it. Not out. Move on.
lofted over the off side, well placed wide of the deep cover
forced off the back foot back to the bowler
picks out midwicket! He went deep in his crease, then down on his knee to sweep. Connected strongly but picked out Mathews on the edge of the ring
watchfully nudged to midwicket
and another! Wasn't much more than a straight delivery and it took an inside edge into the stumps as Finn prodded forward without any conviction
huge appeal for lbw, looked pretty straight as Gurney propped forward but perhaps it was shading down leg side
defended to the leg side
offers up some width and Tredwell throws his arms into a powerful square drive which beats backward point
short ball, he goes for the pull and gets a top edge but it lobs into space on the leg side...Sangakkara unable to get around
to be fair that's well played, gives himself a touch of room outside leg and guides it down to third man
another short one, and again a top edged pull doesn't reach a fielder, this time falling short of fine leg
moving outside leg stump again, this one is full outside off and he just about reaches it, getting a bottom edge to the keeper
and that is that! Aiming to carve through the off side he gets a bottom edge into his stumps

inn2.comm: bouncer first ball, hooked at, it take a big whirl of a top edge and flies over the slips for a one-bounce four, very lucky for Dilshan first up
full length, Dilshan well forward in pressing to cover
short again, this time Dilshan is onto it in a flash and pulls hard and over square leg
back on a length and blocked firmly up the wicket

fuller length, driven seemingly off a thick inside edge but it races back past the bowler and there's a chase back for Root and he can't get there! Goodness that sped away like nothing we've seen today
back of a length, Dilshan goes for the pull again and gets hit on the body
decent length, tried to be turned into the leg side but it comes off the thigh guard in front of point
full at the stumps, driven to mid-on
shorter and pulled, it wasn't that short at all, Dilshan gets a thick inside edge past the stumps to long leg, fortunate again
back of a length again, this is gloves down the leg side and long leg can't prevent the second again running to his right
fuller, pushed from the crease to square leg
fuller still, a drive aimed a the leg side produces an edge via the pad to cover
full length and with the width offered it allows Perera to lash through the line and he cracks it just over cover
shorter ball, dropped into point from just outside off stump
yorker, dug out well into the covers
length ball slightly outside off, steered down to third man
very full on the stumps, pushed carefully up to mid-on
full again, this time squeezed out to square leg
length ball sliding across Perera who waits for it to come on and guides it down to third man
goes to whip a ball on middle to leg and misses, struck on the pad
similar delivery and this time Dilshan manages to turn it down to long leg

pushing quite hard at a length ball just outside off, it was aerial for a time - not too dissimilar to Eoin Morgan's dismissal - but to the right of short extra cover and in the gap past the fielder in the ring
tighter line and blocked up the wicket
forward and calmly pushed out through cover for an easy single

back of a length at the body, pulled into the leg side and finds square leg! Easy catch for Bopara, just popped up by Perera cramped for room and getting the pull all wrong. Change of angle works immediately for Finn; the first ball angled in at Perera and it's done the trick
back over the wicket now, off stump line defended into the covers
pushed slightly further across the leftie who lets this go
tighter line and calmly blocked in the crease
wider once more and left again
around the wicket but Sangakkara can leave this too
middle and off line, pushed square of midwicket for a sharp single
down the track, Moeen fired it in, Sangakkara adjusted and blocked into the leg side
floated up, driven from just outside off to extra cover
forward press from a fifth stump line to short extra
much straighter, touched into the leg side, think it was just pad, balloons towards square leg
length on off stump, calmly blocked back to the bowler
full angled in at the pads, cry for lbw but it was going well down
more off stump and a touch shorter, calmly defended in the crease
superb shot, straight drive off a ball not that full at off, the timing was perfect and it bounces over the non-striker's stumps and whistled to the fence
slower ball, tried to be pulled, Dilshan inside edged it into his pad
bumper, Dilshan hooks, not all that in control but gets enough on it fine of long leg
fuller just outside off, a firm punch to cover ends the over

full, it slides on, Sangakkara struck on the pad and there's a good lbw appeal, turned down, was it sliding down leg? They decline the review, batsman got a good stride in, Hawk Eye had it clipping leg stump
forward blocking more solidly this time
trying to advance, a leading edge skips out to long-on

down the wicket and going big over the leg side, Dilshan gets it all wrong, a leading edge goes straight up in the air, three fielders converge around short mid-on and Woakes takes the catch and England bag an important wicket. Total miscue from Dilshan aiming over the leg side, it went a long way up but Woakes took control of the situation
just a touch short and Sangakkara is back in a flash to cut hard past point
fuller and defended sounded into the covers
and beats the outside edge first ball with a little lifter sliding away from off stump
and again, good line from Gurney, just got it to wobble away a little
this is wrong though and slips down the leg side
fuller and far enough outside off for Jayawardene to leave
middle and off line, blocked carefully coming forward
touch straighter, this is dropped into square leg
full a foot outside off, well left
firm press from just outside off down the ground for a single
down on one knee to paddle, doesn't get it and almost causes trouble for himself but it's safely away from leg stump
this spins down leg and is well taken by Buttler
straighter and blocked up the wicket
swept off a very straight line, only as far as leg slip
a few inches outside off, Jayawardene taps it back up the wicket
touch shorter and the batsman is able to turn this around the corner
poor ball is only flicked from leg stump to long leg
full just outside off, ran carefully to point
nudged into the covers, they set off for a sharp one and have to scramble in
length on off stump, blocked calmly to cover
straighter line and flicked out to long leg
a touch of width but Sangakkara can only find point
forward on off stump, touching with the gentle spin to midwicket
floated up a touch wider and this is gently driven through cover to bring the fifty up
firm sweep off a straight line, gets it in front of backward square but Finn does well in the deep to save the boundary...or does he? Nope, on the replay, his foot was touching the rope
drifts down leg, comfortable wide
forward in front of off stump nudging this to midwicket
swept very fine indeed, it goes between the diving keep and leg slip and runs away for four, bottom edge from the batsman
back just outside off, Jayawardene across his stumps playing to leg
on the stumps, tucked from the crease into square leg
down the wicket rather kicking it away from well outside off
floated up, Sangakkara is back and playing to extra cover
back and cutting hard out to deep cover
played with the angle backward of square leg for an easy single
straight line, worked to midwicket's left and the fielder makes a nice save
full length at the stumps, clipped to midwicket
manages to steer this straighter and down to long-on
off stump line, Sangakkara covering up
paddle swept off a top edge but a safe shot with no short long leg in place, it runs away fine of the deep square
down the wicket and a leading edge from the attempted lofted drive, it loops over extra cover and well short of the in-rushing long-off
forward to a length ball, struck on the pad, would have gone well down
waited for and dabbed cutely past short third man for a couple
forward playing from outside off to short midwicket
swept from outside off this time, gets it to deep backward square
back pushing from just outside off to extra cover
forward this time playing to the same fielder
straighter but Sangakkara exposes his stumps and plays to extra cover again
short of a length, angled into the body and it's deflected down to long leg
full outside off, defended back towards the bowler
tucked off the pads to long leg
round the wicket, full outside off, defended gently into the covers
full and angled towards leg stump, runs behind square on the leg side
nicely-timed drive on the up square of the wicket but it's well cut off by Tredwell at cover
worked from outside off into the leg side, another good piece of fielding from square leg keeps him on strike
again he finds Cook at square leg
lovely delicate touch, opens the face and runs it fine past the keeper and fine of short third man
flicked from outside off to midwicket
a strong sweep this time and gets it backward of square leg
fraction short outside off, Sangakkara waits and then cuts to deep cover
nearly pops a catch to mid-off as he's early on the shot, coming forward into a full ball that perhaps held in the surface
short of a length, runs off the face down to third man
round the wicket, gets onto the pads that's a gift to Jayawardene as he clips it into the vacant square-leg area...the field had just been change for a stronger off-side bias
slower ball, full outside off, he opens the face and sends it to wide third man
good length outside off, defended
short of a length, angled into the body, Sangakkara tucks it off his hip to long leg
he gets lucky here! Drives in the air again, loops over the off-side field and lands in space. Done in the flight by Tredwell
gives himself a touch of room to leg to try that dab to third man but picks out the fielder inside the circle
down the pitch and a strong whip in the air through midwicket...Joe Root is quick at long on
too short, he goes back and cuts to deep cover
works with the turn and clips it to square leg
switches to around the wicket, full on the stumps, eased through straight midwicket
short of a length, on off stump, Jayawardene gets behind the line and defends on his tip toes
good line, on off stump, defended on the back foot
gets too straight, short of a length, flicked off the hip to Moeen at long leg
round the wicket, hitting the pitch back of a length, smartly dropped backward of point to rotate the strike
a strangled appeal, banged in short and flies down the leg side as Jayawardene pulls...may just have grazed the thigh pad
short again, 136kph, Jayawardene has to be on his toes but is comfortably underneath it
round the wicket, full on off stump, forward and defended
driven to short cover
ooh, that's well bowled! The arm-ball, it curved into Sangakkara who was shaping to cut and had to be quick to get his bat down in time
touch shorter, gives him to wait on the back foot and drive to deep cover
flicked to midwicket
another arm ball, pushed across onto off stump, defended
defended from off stump to the covers
short outside off, angled to third man
more deft touch, angled down to third man...he was in control, knew exactly what he was doing. Slip cordon is empty
bouncer, over off stump, he ducks and it's too short
round the wicket, short again, Jayawardene sees it early and pulls over midwicket...not quite timed
another bouncer over leg stump, he lets it sail over his back
short of a length, he hops across the crease and defends to the leg side
round the wicket, full, pushed back to the bowler
punched off the back foot to cover
wider outside off, chopped into the ground and it bobbles to point
comes forward, drives at a length delivery, gets a think inside part of the bat towards midwicket when Bell parries the ball and they steal a single
full outside off, driven to the sweeper
played into the pitch and it bounces to the covers
works a straight delivery to deep square
pushed into the off side
full, driven down to long off
spins into Jayawardene, glances off the pad and leg slip dives to cut it off
picks this up from outside off and sweeps out to deep square-leg
poor ball, full and down the leg side, swept away with no fuss and it races to the fine-leg boundary
opens the face and runs it down to third man
low full toss from round the wicket, punched down the ground to long on
glided down to third man again
driven without much timing this time to mid-off
that's a lovely piece of placement, just adjusts the face at the last moment to find a gap wide of cover
tight to off stump, dabbed down towards short third man
well bowled, beats Sangakkara drive as it grips in some footmarks outside off and spins
defended into the off side
comes down the pitch and makes it into a low full toss which he fetches through midwicket
effortlessly picked off his pads to deep square
more classy stuff from Sangakkara as he plays a well-weighted chip down the ground
a little too short, he just turns it around the corner on the leg side
starts on the pads and it's clipped to deep square
round the wicket, full, in fact a full toss, dug out to mid-on
short of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to the covers
tries to angle this towards third man but can't get it fine enough and backward point, Morgan, cuts it off
good length, defended to mid-on
gets one past the outside edge, short of a length and it defeats Sangakkara's back-foot push
round the wicket, full outside off, flicked along the ground through midwicket
clipped from off stump to the left of mid-on
left alone outside off
pushed across outside off, waits a fraction longer and late-cuts to short third man
opts for the other side this time, flicked out to midwicket
was this a drop? It was certainly close. Jayawardene brought out a big sweep shot, when in the air towards deep square but Finn couldn't quite get to it as he ran in and dived roward
hint of width outside off, and too short, Sangakkara latches on and upper cuts over point...the target quickly coming into sight
dropped, that one certainly carried. Sangakkara bunts it back shin-height to Woakes in his follow through but it clangs out of his hands
lovely timing through midwicket, just a tap from Sangakkara as he works with the angle from round the wicket
aims to work this to leg again, but can only drop it down by his feet
goes for a drive against a full delivery, this time it squirts off a think inside edge through midwicket
pushed into the off side with an open face
Tredwell around the wicket, Jayawardene sweeps to deep square and brings up his 76TH !!! half-century in ODIs
down the track looking to go down the ground, it wasn't perfectly timed but inside mid-on and sufficient club to get it to the rope, hundred partnership now too
this time mid-on can cut off the drive, this all along the floor
back waiting for this to come on, chopping wide of deep cover and they charge back for the second
tossed up outside off, Jayawardene aimed a leg side hoik at ti, sort of pulled out and then swung and missed
much better, a graceful push to deep cover for a single
back of a length and pulled out to deep midwicket
bumper, Sangakkara pulls without conviction and gets hit on the shoulder which runs to point
another short ball, this pulled properly wide of long leg but Gurney does well and saves the boundary with a slide, half-century for Sangakkara now too, not the prettiest
forward just outside off to press into the covers
another pull, not wide enough of deep midwicket for the second
length just outside off, delicate late glance to third man
just outside off, a reverse sweep somehow slips between the keeper and first slip and dances away for four, another sign of England's predicament today
another one, this into the hands of Buttler who dropped it, not sure if there was anything on that
down the track and a gorgeous lofted drive over mid-off, such simple sweep strokemaking
hangs back and tries to cut but it was too full and he missed and almost fell over backwards
this time gets into a proper position to cut and finds deep point
forward just outside off, prodded up the wicket
around the wicket, length angling in and Jayawardene tickles it to deep square
full on the leg stump, flicked wide enough of long leg to allow the second
a step down the wicket and a whack to the leg side, short of deep midwicket, another rather ugly shot from Sangakkara, not at his best today but grinding out the runs
this drifts too far into the body and Jayawardene gets inside the line to play a gentle flick fine of long leg

a step down the wicket and now hoists this down the ground, gets plenty of it and that's the first six of the same over the long-on rope, had to fetch it slightly but the timing was excellent nevertheless
pressing forward to a length ball around off stump, a little nudge/outside edge brings a couple fine of third man
forward just outside off to press to cover
down the wicket to drive firmly to short extra cover
aha, some timing from Sangakkara, down the wicket, staying leg side of the ball and driving over cover, the timing so good the sweeper has no chance
carefully pushed into the covers
down the track again, going leg side this time, a pleasant flick over mid-on and Sri Lanka are a hit away now
booooo...gentle nudge out to deep midwicket
full just outside off pushing to cover
that'll do it, stand and delivery swing to a length ball, smashed straight over the bowler's head
